file_name: PlayboyEnterprisesInc_20090220_10-QA_EX-10.2_4091580_EX-10.2_Content License Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Sales-Purchase Agreement1.pdf

perturbation.original_text: 6.1. Royalties. EFS shall pay a royalty (“Royalty”) to Client to be calculated and paid as follows: (a) the Royalty shall be determined based upon the percentage applicable to the Merchandise Gross Margin (pursuant to the chart in Exhibit 10, attached hereto and hereby incorporated by reference); (b) multiplied by the Net Merchandise Sales (as defined below) as applicable in each case for the applicable Calendar Quarter or Year (each as defined below). The Royalty calculation period shall begin upon the first order received by EFS via any order channel (e.g., on a Website, via mail, fax or telephone) and shall be paid to Client within fifteen (15) days following the conclusion of each calendar quarter (“Calendar Quarter”) based on the calendar year (“Year”), as calculated on the actual Merchandise Gross Margin and Net Merchandise Sales (each as defined below) for such Calendar Quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1. Royalties. EFS shall pay a royalty (“Royalty”) to Client to be calculated and paid as follows: (a) the Royalty shall be determined based upon the percentage applicable to the Merchandise Gross Margin (pursuant to the chart in Exhibit 10, attached hereto and hereby incorporated by reference); (b) multiplied by the Net Merchandise Sales (as defined below) as applicable in each case for the applicable Calendar Quarter or Year (each as defined below). The Royalty calculation period shall begin upon the first order received by EFS via any order channel (e.g., on a Website, via mail, fax or telephone) and shall be paid to Client within **forty-five (45)** days following the conclusion of each calendar quarter (“Calendar Quarter”) based on the calendar year (“Year”), as calculated on the actual Merchandise Gross Margin and Net Merchandise Sales (each as defined below) for such Calendar Quarter.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the payment deadline for royalties. Originally, payment was due within 15 days of the end of each quarter. The modification extends the deadline to 45 days. This inconsistency creates uncertainty about when the royalty payment is actually due, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 6.2. Minimum Royalty. Notwithstanding revenue actually generated by EFS in connection with the Playboy Commerce Business hereunder, it is understood and agreed that the Royalty paid to Client in each Year of the Term shall not be less than the amounts set forth in Exhibit 10 (the “Minimum Royalty”). In the event the Minimum Royalty is not achieved in any Year based on the Royalty payments made in such Year, EFS shall pay the shortfall between the Royalty earned and the applicable Minimum Royalty due, if any, within sixty (60) days of the end of such Year.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.2. Minimum Royalty. Notwithstanding revenue actually generated by EFS in connection with the Playboy Commerce Business hereunder, it is understood and agreed that the Royalty paid to Client in each Year of the Term shall not be less than the amounts set forth in Exhibit 10 (the “Minimum Royalty”). In the event the Minimum Royalty is not achieved in any Year based on the Royalty payments made in such Year, EFS shall pay the shortfall between the Royalty earned and the applicable Minimum Royalty due, if any, within **thirty (30)** days of the end of such Year.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces another contradiction concerning payment deadlines. This time, the deadline for paying any shortfall of the minimum royalty is modified from 60 days to 30 days after the end of the year. This conflicts with the original requirement and creates confusion over the actual deadline.

perturbation.original_text: 6.6. Purchase of Product Inventory. Pursuant to Section 2.2, EFS shall pay Client a non-refundable purchase price of ***** of the wholesale price (i.e., the Client’s original cost) as determined as of forty-five (45) days after the Effective Date for all Client Inventory. Such amount shall be paid Net ninety (90) days following entry of such Client Inventory into EFS’ system; provided, however, that EFS shall enter all such Client Inventory upon receipt or shall promptly notify Client in the event it is unable to do so due to missing information (i.e. barcodes) or because any product is incomplete or otherwise in a condition not fit for immediate resale.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.6. Purchase of Product Inventory. Pursuant to Section 2.2, EFS shall pay Client a non-refundable purchase price of ***** of the wholesale price (i.e., the Client’s original cost) as determined as of forty-five (45) days after the Effective Date for all Client Inventory. Such amount shall be paid Net **sixty (60)** days following entry of such Client Inventory into EFS’ system; provided, however, that EFS shall enter all such Client Inventory upon receipt or shall promptly notify Client in the event it is unable to do so due to missing information (i.e. barcodes) or because any product is incomplete or otherwise in a condition not fit for immediate resale.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a third contradiction. The net payment term for the purchase of product inventory is changed from 90 days to 60 days following entry into EFS's system. This directly conflicts with the original term and creates ambiguity regarding the correct payment deadline, leading to potential disputes.
